verses.verse: And an angel<WH4397> of the Lord<WH3068> came up<WH5927> from Gilgal<WH1537> to Bochim<WH1066>, and said<WH559>, I made you to go up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714>, and have brought<WH935> you unto the land<WH776> which I swore<WH7650> unto your fathers<WH1>; and I said<WH559>, I will never<WH5769> break<WH6565> my covenant with you<WH1285>.

And you shall make<WH3772> no covenant<WH1285> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of this land<WH776>; you shall throw down<WH5422> their altars<WH4196>: but you have not obeyed<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>: why have you done this<WH6213>?
Why I also said<WH559>, I will not drive them out<WH1644> from before<WH6440> you<WH6654>; but they shall be as thorns in your sides, and their gods<WH430> shall be a snare unto you<WH4170>.

And it came to pass<WH4397>, when the angel of the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> these words<WH1697> unto all the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that the people<WH5971> lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.
And they called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Bochim<WH1066>: and they sacrificed<WH2076> there unto the Lord<WH3068>.
And when Joshua<WH3091> had let the people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> every man<WH376> unto his inheritance<WH5159> to possess<WH3423> the land<WH776>.

And the people<WH5971> served<WH5647> the Lord<WH3068> all the days<WH3117> of Joshua<WH3091>, and all the days<WH3117> of the elders<WH2205> that outlived<WH3117> Joshua<WH3091>, who had seen<WH7200> all the great<WH1419> works<WH4639> of the Lord<WH3068>, that he did<WH6213> for Israel<WH3478>.
And Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, the servant<WH5650> of the Lord<WH3068>, died<WH4191>, being a hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>.

And they buried<WH6912> him in the border<WH1366> of his inheritance<WH5159> in Timnath<WH8556>â€“heres, in the mountain<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669>, on the north side<WH6828> of the hill<WH2022> Gaash<WH1608>.

And also all that generation<WH1755> were gathered<WH622> unto their fathers<WH1>: and there arose<WH6965> another<WH312> generation<WH1755> after<WH310> them<WH3045>, which knew not the Lord<WH3068>, nor yet the works<WH4639> which he had done<WH6213> for Israel<WH3478>.
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, and served<WH5647> Baalim<WH1168>:

And they forsook<WH5800> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of their fathers<WH1>, which brought them out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and followed<WH3212> other<WH312> gods<WH430>, of the gods<WH430> of the people<WH5971> that were round about<WH5439> them<WH7812>, and bowed themselves unto them<WH3068>, and provoked the Lord to anger<WH3707>.
And they forsook<WH5800> the Lord<WH3068>, and served<WH5647> Baal<WH1168> and Ashtaroth<WH6252>.

And the anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> was hot<WH2734> against Israel<WH3478>, and he delivered<WH5414> them into the hands<WH3027> of spoilers<WH8154> that spoiled<WH8155> them<WH4376>, and he sold them into the hands<WH3027> of their enemies<WH341> round about<WH5439>, so that they could<WH3201> not any longer<WH5750> stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> their enemies<WH341>.

Wherever they went out<WH3318>, the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> was against them for evil<WH7451>, as the Lord<WH3068> had said<WH1696>, and as the Lord<WH3068> had sworn<WH7650> unto them<WH3966>: and they were greatly distressed<WH3334>.
Nevertheless the Lord<WH3068> raised up<WH6965> judges<WH8199>, which delivered<WH3467> them out of the hand<WH3027> of those that spoiled them<WH8154>.

And yet they would not listen<WH8085> unto their judges<WH8199>, but they went a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods<WH430>, and bowed<WH7812> themselves unto them<WH5493>: they turned quickly<WH4118> out of the way<WH1870> which their fathers<WH1> walked in<WH1980>, obeying<WH8085> the commandments<WH4687> of the Lord<WH3068>; but they did not so<WH6213>.

And when the Lord<WH3068> raised<WH6965> them up judges<WH8199>, then the Lord<WH3068> was with the judge<WH8199>, and delivered<WH3467> them out of the hand<WH3027> of their enemies<WH341> all the days<WH3117> of the judge<WH8199>: for it repented<WH5162> the Lord<WH3068> because<WH6440> of their groanings<WH5009> by reason of them that oppressed<WH3905> them and troubled them<WH1766>.

And it came to pass<WH8199>, when the judge was dead<WH4194>, that they returned<WH7725>, and corrupted<WH7843> themselves more than their fathers<WH1>, in following<WH3212> other<WH312> gods<WH430> to serve<WH5647> them<WH7812>, and to bow down unto them<WH5307>; they ceased not from their own doings<WH4611>, nor from their stubborn<WH7186> way<WH1870>.

And the anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> was hot<WH2734> against Israel<WH3478>; and he said<WH559>, Because that this people<WH1471> has transgressed<WH5674> my covenant<WH1285> which I commanded<WH6680> their fathers<WH1>, and have not listened<WH8085> unto my voice<WH6963>;
I also will not henceforth<WH3254> drive out<WH3423> any<WH376> from before<WH6440> them of the nations<WH1471> which Joshua<WH3091> left<WH5800> when he died<WH4191>:
That through them I may prove<WH5254> Israel<WH3478>, whether they will keep<WH8104> the way<WH1870> of the Lord<WH3068> to walk<WH3212> in it<WH1>, as their fathers did keep it<WH8104>, or not.
Therefore the Lord<WH3068> left<WH3240> those nations<WH1471>, without<WH1115> driving them out<WH3423> hastily<WH4118>; neither delivered<WH5414> he them into the hand<WH3027> of Joshua<WH3091>.
